channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pot hole on turning, 11th January
item.description:
A large pothole is on the tarmac between Ullenwood Manor Road and Leckhampton Hill as you turn left at this junction. It is quite deep and you can see the lighter road surface underneath. It has been there for a few months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ullenwood Manor Lane, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road is breaking up, 11th January
item.description:
As the tarmac changes from the bridge back to 'normal' road the tarmac is severely breaking up. Issue has been getting worse over the last 6 months at least
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 60cm wide pothole, 11th January
item.description:
There are several potholes on Harp Hill Road, including one large pothole approximately 60 cm in diameter. This is particularly dangerous due to the steep gradient of the road, which causes vehicles to approach at higher speeds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Battledown, Cheltenham

item.title: Previous sinkhole dipping again, 11th January
item.description:
Outside 20 sherbourne place. Road is sinking again after a failed repair last year. Cowpat repair put in a couple of weeks ago. Failing already. Cars are scraping the road. Going to cause vehicle damage if left.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41-47, Fairview Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on bridge and wall by entrance. Netting broken underneath and filling up with rubbish and birds, dead and alive. Lots of poo on path underneath. Small pike of rubble on path washed down from bridge drain., 11th January
item.description:
Honeybourne bridge Market Street
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Street, St Paulâ€™s, Cheltenham

item.title: Numerous potholes, 11th January
item.description:
There are numerous potholes now in Village Road from Newdawn Place north to the bus shelter. They are gerowing with each rain storm as evidenced by the amount of debris being thrown up with the frosty conditions followed heavy rain. This issue is being exacerbated by the amount of gutter flooding due to blocked drains, which has on numerous occasions extended a full third of the way across the road. this is making the eastern footpath unsafe for pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gravel walk has numerous issues, the road has collapsed in many places including a very large pothole near the substation and damage to the sewer chamber which has just been filled with soft tarmac. This will not solve the issue with the chamber. The road has collapsed near verges down the entirety of the road due to the use of heavy building machinery, 11th January
item.description:
Top of Gravel walk and throughout the whole of the road which is now in a terrible state
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Pothole on Hyde Lane, 11th January
item.description:
There is a large pothole on Hyde Lane which is incredibly dangerous. It has caused a blow out on my car today. The pot hole is near to the lay by.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faded white line across entrance to Hambrook St / dangerous junction, 11th January
item.description:
The previous white access line has worn away therefore people tend to park too close to the junction. This limits visibility and has caused multiple near collisions when one car has to blindly pull out of hambrook street as another is driving 30mph down Ryeworth Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hambrook Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Road marking white lines or studs

item.title: Kerb wedges, 11th January
item.description:
2 kerb wedges have been put outside 38 swallow crescent to allow them to bump the kerb (which isn't a dropped kerb) and park on their front garden. Which is dangerous for vehicles driving as they get in the way and could cause damage to vehicles and pedestrians and I believe they arnt allowed as its an obstruction on the highway
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swallow Crescent, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various holes in the road, need repair as trip hazard and causing damage to vehicles, 11th January

Outside no 5 and 7 rookery Road Innsworth : Has been like it since before Christmas
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rookery Road, Innsworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Large deep pothole, 11th January
item.description:
Albert Road, where one direction has to give way to oncoming traffic so is obviously being driven on more. Not sure if I have exact postal code but there are only 2 areas as described above so can easily be recognised. It is very deep and wide and cant be avoided. There are also other bad areas in general of the road surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
